title: Deadly strikes in Gaza as Netanyahu says Israel will seize new military corridor
snippets: At least 19 people are reported killed in Jabalia as Israel's PM says it is expanding ground operations to pressure Hamas.
summary: At least 19 individuals were reported dead in Jabalia. Concurrently, Israel's Prime Minister announced an expansion of ground operations aimed at pressuring Hamas.
titles: Deadly strikes in Gaza as Netanyahu says Israel will seize new military corridor

title: Inside Mandalay: BBC joins rescuers searching for earthquake dead in Myanmar
snippets: The BBC’s Yogita Limaye is the first foreign journalist to enter the country since the disaster struck.
summary: Yogita Limaye of the BBC has become the first foreign journalist to enter the country following a recent disaster, marking a significant moment in the coverage of the event.
titles: Inside Mandalay: BBC joins rescuers searching for earthquake dead in Myanmar

title: Dead or alive? Surviving Pakistan’s 28-hour train hijack in an engine
snippets: Assistant train driver Saad Qamar's family didn't know if he had been killed. On Thursday, he'll be back at work.
summary: Assistant train driver Saad Qamar, previously feared dead by his family, will return to work on Thursday.
titles: Dead or alive? Surviving Pakistan’s 28-hour train hijack in an engine

title: World leaders criticise Trump tariffs as 'major blow'
snippets: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen says US tariffs will see "uncertainty spiral" as world leaders react to Trump's announcement.
summary: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen warns that US tariffs will lead to increased uncertainty globally, following President Trump's announcement. World leaders are responding to the new trade measures.
titles: World leaders criticise Trump tariffs as 'major blow'

title: Inside Mandalay: BBC finds huge devastation and little help for Myanmar quake survivors
snippets: Yogita Limaye is the one of the first foreign journalists to enter Myanmar since a huge earthquake hit the war-torn country.
summary: Yogita Limaye became one of the first foreign journalists to enter Myanmar following a significant earthquake in the conflict-affected nation.
titles: Inside Mandalay: BBC finds huge devastation and little help for Myanmar quake survivors

title: Ovechkin nets 892nd, now 3 from breaking mark
snippets: Alex Ovechkin moved three goals away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record after scoring the 892nd of his career in the Capitals' loss at Carolina on Wednesday night.
summary: Alex Ovechkin scored his 892nd career goal during the Capitals' game against Carolina, bringing him three goals shy of surpassing Wayne Gretzky's NHL record. Despite his milestone, the Capitals lost the match.
titles: Ovechkin nets 892nd, now 3 from breaking mark

title: Agent's Take: Breaking down Micah Parsons' contract complications, how Cowboys star should proceed in talks
snippets: A look at what is getting to be a murkier contract negotiation between Dallas and Parsons' camp
summary: Contract negotiations between Dallas and Parsons' camp are becoming increasingly complex and unclear.
titles: Agent's Take: Breaking down Micah Parsons' contract complications, how Cowboys star should proceed in talks

title: Alex Ovechkin goals tracker: Capitals star three away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's all-time record
snippets: At his season-long scoring pace, Ovechkin would pass the 'The Great One' in the final game of the season
summary: Alex Ovechkin is on track to surpass Wayne Gretzky's all-time scoring record in the final game of the season, maintaining his current scoring pace.
titles: Alex Ovechkin goals tracker: Capitals star three away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's all-time record

title: Ohtani's walk-off pushes Dodgers to historic 8-0
snippets: Shohei Ohtani delivered again, hitting a walk-off home run to beat the Braves in the ninth to make the Dodgers the first reigning champ to begin a season 8-0.
summary: Shohei Ohtani hit a walk-off home run, leading the Dodgers to defeat the Braves and achieve an 8-0 start to the season. This marks the first time a reigning champion has begun a season with such a record.
titles: Ohtani's walk-off pushes Dodgers to historic 8-0

title: AD clears 'mental hurdle,' keys Mavs' win late
snippets: Anthony Davis scored the go-ahead basket with 3.4 seconds left, then smothered Trae Young on a switch, forcing a tightly contested step-back 3 that failed to draw iron at the buzzer as Dallas closed out Atlanta 120-118.
summary: Anthony Davis scored the decisive basket with 3.4 seconds remaining and then played crucial defense against Trae Young, preventing him from scoring in the final moments. This led Dallas to secure a 120-118 victory over Atlanta.
titles: AD clears 'mental hurdle,' keys Mavs' win late

title: Amazon, AppLovin Bid To Buy TikTok Ahead of Deadline, Reports Say
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Amazon and AppLovin have reportedly submitted bids to buy TikTok, ahead of a U.S. ban set to go into effect this weekend if no deal is reached with the app's Chinese parent company.
  • Several others have previously expressed interest in buying TikTok, including "Shark Tank" host Kevin O'Leary and Project Liberty founder Frank McCourt, along with Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian.
  • Trump is meeting with White House officials Wednesday to review an offer led by Oracle, according to reports.


Amazon (AMZN) and adtech firm AppLovin (APP) have become the latest firms to bid for TikTok, ahead of a U.S. ban of the app set to go into effect Saturday if no deal is reached with the app's Chinese parent company.

Amazon submitted a letter outlining its bid to Vice President JD Vance and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, according to a New York Times report Wednesday. However, officials involved in talks are not taking the offer seriously, the report said, citing people familiar with the bid.

Meanwhile, AppLovin has met with former Wynn Resorts (WYNN) CEO Steve Wynn about possible financial backing, according to a Wall Street Journal report Wednesday.

Amazon declined to remark on its reported bid, while AppLovin did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Shares of Amazon gained 2% and AppLovin shares added close to 3% Wednesday.

The offers come as Trump is meeting with Vance, Lutnick and other officials Wednesday about a potential deal led by Oracle (ORCL), according to reporting from the New York Times and others. Wedbush analysts told clients in a note Tuesday that they believe Oracle's offer could potentially serve as “a linchpin to safeguarding US consumer data” on the platform.

The analysts added they expect “some outline of a deal” could be announced before Friday night, but that an extension might also be issued to allow the parties involved to iron out details. If no deal for TikTok is reached, a U.S. ban of the app is set to go into effect Saturday, after President Trump signed an executive order in January delaying the action by 75 days.

Several others have also previously expressed interest in buying TikTok, including "Shark Tank" host Kevin O'Leary and Project Liberty founder Frank McCourt, who had submitted a proposal in January. Reddit (RDDT) co-founder Alexis Ohanian joined the bid in March.
summary: Amazon and Applovin have placed bids to purchase TikTok, as a U.S. ban looms this weekend unless a deal is made with its Chinese parent company. Other interested buyers include Kevin O'Leary, Frank McCourt, and Alexis Ohanian. The Trump administration is reviewing an Oracle-led offer, with a potential ban delayed until Saturday. Amazon's bid, outlined to Vice President JD Vance and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, has reportedly not been taken seriously. Applovin discussed financial backing with Steve Wynn. Both companies’ stocks rose following the news. An Oracle deal is seen as key to prot
titles: Amazon, AppLovin Bid To Buy TikTok Ahead of Deadline, Reports Say

title: Global stocks tumble as investors move into haven assets
snippets: President reveals plans to impose 10% universal levies and higher duties on major partners
summary: The President announced intentions to implement a 10% universal levy alongside increased duties on key trading partners. This move aims to adjust the current economic policies, although specific details on the timing and scope of these changes were not disclosed.
titles: Global stocks tumble as investors move into haven assets

title: Trump’s tariffs in brief: universal levies and targeted retaliation
snippets: The new duties imposed by the US president will send shockwaves through global supply chains
summary: The US president has imposed new duties that are expected to significantly impact global supply chains.
titles: Trump’s tariffs in brief: universal levies and targeted retaliation

title: Reciprocal tariffs: you won’t believe how they came up with the numbers
snippets: There is some method to the madness — it’s just a nonsensical method
summary: The statement suggests that while there appears to be a system or rationale behind certain actions or decisions, it is fundamentally illogical or lacks practical sense.
titles: Reciprocal tariffs: you won’t believe how they came up with the numbers

title: Trump escalates global trade war with sweeping tariff blitz
snippets: EU warns of ‘major blow’ to global economy as US president reveals plans for 10% universal levies and higher ‘reciprocal’ duties
summary: The EU has issued a warning about a significant negative impact on the global economy following the announcement by the US president of plans to implement a universal 10% levy and increase 'reciprocal' duties.
titles: Trump escalates global trade war with sweeping tariff blitz

title: Southern Ocean warming will mean a wetter West Coast, US
snippets: As global temperatures warm, the Southern Ocean -- between Antarctica and other continents -- will eventually release heat absorbed from the atmosphere, leading to projected long-term increases in precipitation over East Asia and the Western U.S., regardless of climate mitigation efforts.
summary: Rising global temperatures will cause the Southern Ocean to release absorbed atmospheric heat, resulting in more rainfall in East Asia and the Western U.S. over the long term, unaffected by climate mitigation strategies.
titles: Southern Ocean warming will mean a wetter West Coast, US

title: Novel point-of-care technology delivers accurate HIV results in minutes
snippets: The technology described uses a nanomechanical platform and tiny cantilevers to detect multiple HIV antigens at high sensitivity in a matter of minutes. These silicon cantilevers are cheap and easy to mass produce and can be readily equipped with a digital readout. Built into a solar-powered device, this technology could be taken to hard-to-reach parts of the world where early detection remains a challenge to deliver fast interventions to vulnerable populations without waiting for a lab.
summary: A new technology employing nanomechanical platforms with silicon cantilevers can detect HIV antigens quickly and sensitively. These cantilevers are inexpensive, easy to produce, and can be integrated with a digital readout. Designed for a solar-powered device, this innovation aims to facilitate early HIV detection in remote areas, offering rapid results without the need for laboratory analysis.
titles: Novel point-of-care technology delivers accurate HIV results in minutes

title: Study finds nearly five-fold increase in hospitalizations for common cause of stroke
snippets: Cervical artery dissection is a tear in an artery in the neck that provides blood flow to the brain. Such a tear can result in blood clots that cause stroke. A new study has found almost a five-fold increase in the number of U.S. hospitalizations for cervical artery dissection over a 15-year period.
summary: A new study reveals a nearly five-fold increase in U.S. hospitalizations for cervical artery dissection, a condition involving a tear in a neck artery leading to the brain, over 15 years. This tear can lead to blood clots and strokes.
titles: Study finds nearly five-fold increase in hospitalizations for common cause of stroke

title: Study reveals how alcohol abuse damages cognition
snippets: For the first time researchers demonstrate in an animal how heavy alcohol use leads to long-term behavioral issues by damaging brain circuits critical for decision-making.
summary: Researchers have for the first time shown in an animal study that heavy alcohol consumption can cause long-term behavioral problems by damaging brain circuits essential for decision-making.
titles: Study reveals how alcohol abuse damages cognition

title: Scientists unveil starfish-inspired wearable tech for heart monitoring
snippets: When we move, it's harder for existing wearable devices to accurately track our heart activity. But researchers found that a starfish's five-arm shape helps solve this problem. Inspired by how a starfish flips itself over -- shrinking one of its arms and using the others in a coordinated motion to right itself -- scientists have created a starfish-shaped wearable device that tracks heart health in real time.
summary: Researchers have developed a starfish-shaped wearable device that improves the tracking of heart activity during movement. This innovation, inspired by the way a starfish moves its arms to flip over, allows for real-time monitoring of heart health by mimicking the starfish's five-arm coordination.
titles: Scientists unveil starfish-inspired wearable tech for heart monitoring
